THE game on Steam, now and forever. It’s so good that most people will probably download it without reading the reviews. That technically makes this pointless but it’s still fun. CSGO is a run-and-gun (and fun!) twitch shooter with a variety of gamemodes. The most popular ones are bomb defusal and hostage rescue (other modes include gun game, deathmatch, and low gravity snipers). The maps are perfectly made, combining right angles, choke points, and windows to create a symphony of bullets. Guns are amazing to shoot and kills are always satisfying. Valve keeps things fresh by rotating in new maps and there’s occasionally a battlepass. Speaking of which, the skins/items make up half the game. Take a look around the community market and you’ll see why. People trade and sell items as a job. If you love collecting things and showing off then you’ll love it. The prime upgrade is unfortunately essential. The upgrade includes more bad items as you level up and better matchmaking. In other words, matchmaking without cheaters. Still though, I can’t recommend this enough, it’s free so there’s really no reason not to try it out. Even after taking nearly a year off I was able to get sucked right back in…

(Side note: Kudos to Valve for making some of (if not the) best bots ever. Bots are available for every mode if you want to play by yourself and offer a range of difficulties. The expert bots actually feel like real players. So much so, that I’ve spent hours practicing with them. If you can’t stand other people (aka cheaters) it’s still worth it.)
